title: How New NASA, India Earth Satellite NISAR Will See Earth
summary: Set to launch within a few months, NISAR will use a technique called synthetic aperture radar to produce incredibly detailed maps of surface change on our planet. title: NASA Welcomes Finland as Newest Artemis Accords Signatory
summary: With Finland’s signing of the Artemis Accords on Tuesday, NASA celebrates the 53rd nation committing to the safe and responsible exploration of space that benefits humanity. title: Suni Williams Conducts Spacewalk
summary: NASA astronaut Suni Williams is seen outside the International Space Station during the Jan. 16, 2025, spacewalk where she and fellow NASA astronaut Nick Hague replaced a rate gyro assembly that helps maintain the orientation of the orbital outpost. title: Station Science Top News: Jan. 17, 2025
summary: Insights into metal alloy solidification Researchers report details of phase and structure in the solidification of metal alloys on the International Space Station, including formation of microstructures. Because these microstructures determine a material’s mechanical properties, this work could support improvements in techniques for producing coatings and additive manufacturing or 3D printing processes. title: ESA Selects Consortia to Define Payload Platforms for Mars Tug
summary:
As part of its LightShip initiative, the European Space Agency has chosen four consortia to conduct parallel studies to define small, low-cost Mars satellite platforms. The ESA Mars LightShip tug is a proposed interplanetary transfer service that will ferry satellites to Mars orbit. With this initiative, ESA aims to reduce the cost of mounting a […]
